newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks end low after positive start.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks end low after positive start.

text.p: Pakistani stocks ended lower on profit-taking on Sunday after a positive start owing to short-covering, and are likely to open mixed on Monday's clearing day, dealers said.
The Karachi Stock Exchange (KSE) 100-share index ended 2.34 points, or 0.17 percent, lower at 1,360.56 amid 116 gainers and 117 losers.

"After a positive start, the market took a bearish turn in mid-session and failed to maintain a forward march witnessed on Thursday," dealer Ali Raza said. "Values oscillated in a thin range as investors decided to take a cautious."
Raza said investment and speculative scrips depicted no major change.
There was no major buying from local and foreign financial institutions, a broker said.
Fauji Fertilizer fell 0.95 to 63.30 rupees, PTCL 0.10 to 34.15, HUBCO 0.10 to 30.60 and Dewan Salman 0.35 to 22.90.
